noun.description: A stone or concrete edging to a street or path.
A check or restraint on something.
examples: curbs on the powers of labor unions

noun.description: A type of bit that is widely used in western riding. In English riding it is usually only used with a snaffle as part of a double bridle.
A swelling on the back of a horse's hock, caused by spraining a ligament.

examples: she promised she would curb her temper

verb.description: Lead (a dog being walked) near the curb to urinate or defecate, in order to avoid soiling buildings, sidewalks, etc.

origin: Late 15th century (denoting a strap fastened to the bit): from Old French courber bend, bow, from Latin curvare (see curve).
